info.title: About VAT
info.description: Value Added Tax (VAT) is a consumption tax placed on a product whenever value is added at each stage of the supply chain and at the point of sale.

howItWorks.title: How VAT Calculation Works
howItWorks.explanation: VAT (Value Added Tax) is calculated as a percentage of the net price. To add VAT, multiply the price by (1 + rate/100). To extract VAT from a gross price, divide by (1 + rate/100) to find the net price.

commonMistakes.title: Using Wrong VAT Rate
commonMistakes.description: VAT rates vary by country and product type. Using the wrong rate leads to incorrect pricing and potential tax compliance issues.

commonMistakes.title: Confusing VAT-Inclusive and Exclusive Prices
commonMistakes.description: Mixing up whether a price includes VAT or not leads to significant calculation errors. Always clarify the price basis.

commonMistakes.title: Forgetting Reduced Rates
commonMistakes.description: Many countries apply reduced VAT rates to essentials like food, books, or medical supplies. Using standard rate when reduced applies overcharges customers.

commonMistakes.title: Rounding Errors
commonMistakes.description: Inconsistent rounding of VAT amounts across multiple items can create discrepancies in invoices and tax filings.

faqs.question: What is VAT and how does it work?
faqs.answer: VAT is a consumption tax added at each stage of production. Businesses collect VAT on sales, deduct VAT paid on purchases, and remit the difference to tax authorities.

faqs.question: What are common VAT rates worldwide?
faqs.answer: Standard VAT rates vary: UK 20%, EU 17-27%, Saudi Arabia 15%, UAE 5%, Australia (GST) 10%. Many countries have reduced rates for essentials.

faqs.question: How do I extract VAT from a VAT-inclusive price?
faqs.answer: Divide the gross price by (1 + VAT rate/100). For a $115 price with 15% VAT: $115 / 1.15 = $100 net price, $15 VAT.

faqs.question: Is VAT the same as sales tax?
faqs.answer: They're similar but different. VAT is collected at each production stage with businesses reclaiming VAT on inputs. Sales tax is typically collected only at final sale to consumers.

faqs.question: Do all businesses need to charge VAT?
faqs.answer: Most countries have VAT registration thresholds. Businesses below the threshold may not need to register. Once registered, you must charge and report VAT.

howItWorks.title: How Sales Tax Calculation Works
howItWorks.explanation: Sales tax is a percentage added to the subtotal at the point of sale. Unlike VAT, sales tax is only collected once at the final consumer sale. Rates vary by state, county, and city in the US, and by region in other countries.

seoTips: US sales tax varies from 0% (Oregon, Delaware) to 10%+ (some California cities)
Many states exempt groceries, medicine, and clothing from sales tax
Online sellers may need to collect tax in multiple states based on economic nexus
Always verify current tax rates - they change frequently
Consider use tax for out-of-state purchases where sales tax wasn't collected

commonMistakes.title: Using Statewide Rate Only
commonMistakes.description: Total sales tax often includes state, county, and city components. Use the combined rate for your specific location.

commonMistakes.title: Ignoring Exemptions
commonMistakes.description: Many items like groceries, medicine, or clothing may be exempt or taxed at reduced rates. Know your local exemptions.

commonMistakes.title: Not Tracking Rate Changes
commonMistakes.description: Tax rates change frequently. Ensure your calculations use current rates, especially for business applications.

commonMistakes.title: Confusing Sales Tax with VAT
commonMistakes.description: Sales tax is charged only at final sale to consumers. VAT is charged at each production stage with input credits.

faqs.question: How do I find my local sales tax rate?
faqs.answer: Check your state's department of revenue website. Rates vary by state, county, and city. Some areas have special district taxes too.

faqs.question: What is the average US sales tax rate?
faqs.answer: Average combined state and local rate is about 7.12%. Ranges from 0% (5 states have no sales tax) to over 10% in some cities.

faqs.question: Do I need to collect sales tax for online sales?
faqs.answer: Usually yes, if you have economic nexus in the buyer's state. Rules vary by state - research or use automated tax software.

faqs.question: How do I extract tax from a tax-inclusive price?
faqs.answer: Subtotal = Total / (1 + Tax Rate). For $107 with 7% tax: $107 / 1.07 = $100 subtotal, $7 tax.

faqs.question: Are there items exempt from sales tax?
faqs.answer: Varies by state. Common exemptions include groceries, prescription drugs, medical equipment, and sometimes clothing. Check your state's rules.
